before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"68e9a","text":"Viruses encoding for genetically encoded optical sensors are intracranially injected in the selected area of the brain by stereotaxic surgery. Imaging is performed 3-4 weeks after injections to ensure appropriate expression levels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2j5l0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8kkd0","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

55767.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4fj34","text":"Set up vibratome","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tuqq","text":"Carefully clean blade with ethanol and water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4b6db","text":"Using a hex wrench, insert blade in blade holder assembly","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"et3o8","text":"Run VibroCheck calibration","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bcpat","text":"Place buffer tray in ice tray and fill ice tray with ice; load on to vibratome","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2d9cq","text":"Superglue a rectangular piece (~2 cm x 1 cm x 1 cm) of 3% agar onto the specimen plate ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"29bsn","text":"Make 1X ACSF:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vk99","text":"Prepare 1 L per {"blocks":[{"key":"de21k","text":"Make 1X cutting solution:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52e2m","text":"Prepare 250 mL per mouse","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ce26f","text":"   +   +    +   +    ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":5,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":14,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bn7um","text":"Chill on ice and bubble with 95% O2 / 5% CO2.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":34,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":43,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6tkhq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"225","error":false,"guid":"CC5B230057D811ECAECC3DE0D09831B4","id":0,"label":"MilliQH2O","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"DC79B94057D811ECAECC3DE0D09831B4","id":0,"label":"stock 10X cutting solution","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.5","error":false,"guid":"EA6717A057D811ECAECC3DE0D09831B4","id":0,"label":"NaHCO3","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.125","error":false,"guid":"02BAD08057D911ECAECC3DE0D09831B4","id":0,"label":"glucose","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4.3","error":false,"guid":"F8EB85E057D811ECAECC3DE0D09831B4","id":0,"label":"sucrose","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e4321","text":"Dissect brain and glue it to specimen plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"751h6","text":"Insert plate in buffer tray and fill tray with 1X cutting solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e379b","text":"Lower blade into solution, set front and back limits and settings.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9c0n8","text":"Slice at 0.8 mm/s","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvif2","text":"  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aqvvv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"thickness","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error":false,"guid":"D57CDDA057DA11ECAECC3DE0D09831B4","id":0,"label":"slices","scientificNotation":false,"unit":202,"value":"240"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3mqak","text":"Collect relevant slices as they come off the blade, and carefully transfer to warmed slice vial.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2s3p","text":"Recover slices at   and bubbled for at least 45 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":18,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"0AA606F057DB11ECAECC3DE0D09831B4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"32","unit":10}}}}

86549.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5enk9","text":"Rig set-up.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7uo90","text":"Set 1X ACSF (add drugs needed for particular experiments) in a jug or bottle and bubble it with O2/CO2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":97,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":101,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1e17h","text":"Open the N2 tank connected to the rig anti-vibration table.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":10,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hjvc","text":"Turn on required devices (computer, amplifier, manipulators, light sources, video camara controls, etc.) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5rrek","text":"Recording electrodes or patch pipettes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7i48","text":"Pull patch pipettes (1.5 – 2 MΩ) (World Precision Instruments) using an electrode puller (Narishige, PC-10).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7c53e","text":"Thaw an aliquot of the appropriate internal solution (stored at   (see 'Solutions' section below) (add ATP, GTP and Phosphocreatine if solution does not already have it). Fill a syringe with filter with the internal solution and keep on ice by the rig.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":64,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a4bcc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cun1v","text":"Electrical stimulation electrodes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76udh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qr3r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"g99j","text":"Pull electrodes (World Precision Instruments) using a puller (Narishige, PC-10).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c7b97","text":"Fill electrodes with 1X ACSF using a syringe with filter. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fhjtf","text":"Place the intake line into the ACSF container and allow circulation. Wait until the fluid has entered the recording chamber, then turn on the in-line heater (Warner Instruments) and set it to desired temperature  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":212,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"k2f8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"32-34","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"24km9","text":"Transfer brain slice from incubation vial to the recording chamber and secure down the slice using a harp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5642i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lmri","text":"(The protocol for obtaining acute brain slices is linked below).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6mae","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f85kf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"creator":{"affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/avatars/011.png","source":"/img/avatars/011.png","webp_source":""},"link":null,"name":"kelsey.barcomb","username":"m4xle102z115yle1"},"guid":"","id":55767,"image":{"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null,"webp_source":null},"load_collapsed":true,"stats":{"number_of_steps":13},"title":"Acute Brain Slices ","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eAcute Brain Slices \u003c/p\u003e","type_id":1,"uri":"acute-brain-slices-b2pxqdpn"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ss9b","text":"Locate and focus the desired region of the brain under the 4x objective.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hrbk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9s0fu","text":"Change the microscope lens to the 40x or 60x objective focus on healthy neurons selected for patching.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"etd62","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9aqs4","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eao7t","text":"Fill a pipette tip with internal solution. Remove any air bubbles by gently flicking the glass pipette.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6mut3","text":"Place the pipette onto the wire electrode on the holder and tighten.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fu18c","text":"Apply a positive pressure and maintain it by quickly closing the stopcock. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e5d86","text":"Position the electrode using a micromanipulator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f6alk","text":"Under the 40x-60x immersion objective, bring the tip of the pipette above the slice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"737d8","text":"Approach the cell until the positive pressure create a small dimple.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6p3g5","text":"Zero the pipette offset, release the positive pressure, and apply a small amount of negative pressure. The resistance should start to increase rapidly until a giga-Ohm seal is formed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dsp48","text":"Clamp the cell at your resting potential of interest (typically -60 mV).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"362sb","text":"Apply a few quick pulses of negative pressure to break into the cell and reach the whole-cell configuration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ia4","text":"Wait   to allow the internal solution to dialyze the cell before start your recordings. Cells were discarded if series resistance was ≥15 MΩ.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"elcp5","text":"Reordings can be made in voltage-clamp or current-clamp modes and the acquisition protocol will differ depending on the experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73g09","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8c5qf","text":"Once finished the recording of a particular cell, set the holding potential to 0 mV and remove the electrode. Discard the electrode in sharps container.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"78agf","text":"Optogenetic stimulation: deliver light pulses using using a 478 nm LED. Select the appropriate number of pulses, intensity and duration of light stimulation for the experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9jgtb","text":"Electrical stimulation: position the monopolar glass stimulating electrode filled with ACSF consistently 200 µm away from the recorded cell. Select the appropriate number of pulses, intensity and duration of electrical stimulation for the experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

creator.name: Beatriz E Nielsen
creator.affiliation: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus

affiliations.affiliation: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"da8mt","text":"This protocol describes the steps for imaging dendritic calcium transients evoked by backprogating action potentials. 2-photon imaging was performed using a 2-photon laser scanning microscopy system, custom-built on a BX51WI microscope (Olympus). A Ti:Sapphire laser (Chameleon Ultra I; Coherent) was tuned to emit pulsed excitation at 920 nm and scanned using a pair of X-Y galvanometer mirrors (6215, Cambridge Technology). Emitted fluorescence was collected through a water-immersion objective (60X, Olympus), a dichroic mirror (T700LPXXR, Chroma) and filters (ET680sp and ET525/50 m-2P, Chroma), and was detected using a GaAsP photomultiplier tube (PMT, H10770PA-40, Hamamatsu). A current preamplifier (SR570, Stanford Research Systems) was used to convert the output to voltage, which was then digitized by a data acquisition card (PCI-6110, National Instruments).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"cbkre","text":"2-photon laser scanning microscopy system, custom-built on a BX51WI microscope (Olympus).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1af4h","text":"Ti:Sapphire laser (Chameleon Ultra I; Coherent).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvhsr","text":"X-Y galvanometer mirrors (6215, Cambridge Technology).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbd3r","text":"Dichroic mirror (T700LPXXR, Chroma).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8rpq","text":"Filters (ET680sp and ET525/50 m-2P, Chroma).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62anq","text":"GaAsP photomultiplier tube (PMT, H10770PA-40, Hamamatsu).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"18hml","text":"Current preamplifier (SR570, Stanford Research Systems).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvrbs","text":"Data acquisition card (PCI-6110, National Instruments).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bc8c4","text":"Toronado: https://github.com/StrowbridgeLab/Toronado-Laser-Scanning ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":10,"length":57}],"data":{}},{"key":"7uo7k","text":"Axograph X (Axograph Scientific).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"71393CDE3D2011EE855C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/StrowbridgeLab/Toronado-Laser-Scanning"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"asq9f","text":"Pull patch pipettes (1.5 – 2 MΩ) (World Precision Instruments) using an electrode puller (Narishige, PC-10).\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8uhb5","text":"Thaw an aliquot of the K-Gluconate internal solution for calcium imaging (stored at    )","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":85,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"40ian","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aoaaf","text":"+ 1 mg/mL ATP , 0.1 mg/mL GTP  and 1.5 mg/mL phosphocreatine","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hu57","text":"pH=7.35,  275 mOsm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tk25","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9347","text":"Add   Alexa Fluor 594 to visualize dendritic arbor morphology and  Fluo-5F, a calcium indicator, to enable the detection of dendritic calcium transients.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":65,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dv270","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9uoht","text":"Fill a syringe with filter with the internal solution and keep on ice by the rig.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100],"data":[["Drug","[mM]","g/100 steps.section: Ex vivo electrophysiology and Ca+2 transient 2-photon imaging
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"er6o5","text":"Transfer brain slice from incubation vial to the recording chamber and secure down the slice using a harp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Ex vivo electrophysiology and Ca+2 transient 2-photon imaging
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"595uk","text":"Locate and focus on the desired region of the brain under IR-DIC using the low power (4x) objective.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Ex vivo electrophysiology and Ca+2 transient 2-photon imaging
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"54oj2","text":"Change the microscope lens to high power (60x) objective and focus on a healthy cell to patch.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Ex vivo electrophysiology and Ca+2 transient 2-photon imaging
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ku5i","text":"Record the peak fluorescent changes of the calcium indicator Fluo-5F under the 2-photon spot photometry or 2-photon point scanning acquisition mode in Toronado, which allows to measure high-speed changes of fluorescence. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":80,"length":24},{"style":"italic","offset":106,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pcck","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4rfn","text":"Select an individual spot (ROI) from rasterized image under appropriate 'Zoom' 'Morph' options. The 2P laser will be scanned across a circular path (diameter: 150 nm) centered at this spot, and emitted fluorescence will be continuously measured.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjkue","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66i6q","text":"Set and run a protocol in Axograph to elicit a single backpropagating action potential (bAP) by injecting a somatic depolarizing current in current-clamp mode and add a 'Photometry' (TTL) pulse on that protocol with the same duration as the photometry pulse set on Toronado. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4i7at","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gti9","text":"Image three to five dendritic spots in the same optical plane to have an average per cell. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"313bk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"erbjf","text":"Different drugs can be applied after recording a baseline period. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1u0b6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fcir","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"brip5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"76c5e","text":"Laser power must be tuned by adjusting attenuation through Pockels cells so that the fluorescence at baseline is bright enough but far from signal saturation.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Ex vivo electrophysiology and Ca+2 transient 2-photon imaging
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d916k","text":"Turn off IR light source and switch to 2-photon laser scanning mode by sliding mirror to allow 2P laser excitation (wavelength: 810 nm), opening iris to PMTs, and start imaging using Toronado software and Axograph. Turn on PMT and dynode power sources.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Ex vivo electrophysiology and Ca+2 transient 2-photon imaging
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a5i94","text":"Select a region of interest in the dendritic arbor to measure the calcium transients using an appropriate zoom in Toronado.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Ex vivo electrophysiology and Ca+2 transient 2-photon imaging
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f7air","text":"Follow the steps indicated in the protocol linked below for whole cell recordings in \"current clamp\" mode.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pub7","text":"Allow the internal solution containing the dyes to dialyze the cell before start your recordings.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dub1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fmelj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":86549,"title":"Ex vivo electrophysiology","title_html":"Ex vivo electrophysiology","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"ex-vivo-electrophysiology-cyrvxv66","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Beatriz E Nielsen","affiliation":"University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus","affiliation_url":"University of Colorado","username":"beatriz-e-nielsen","link":"","user_image_file":{"guid":"00000000000000000000000000000001","file_name":"avatar.png","url":"https://www.protocols.io/img/avatars/001.png","mime":"image/png","size":0,"width":100,"height":100,"avg_color":"","scan_status":0,"created_at":0}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":29},"type_id":1,"guid":"FE599DC03C4511EE832811540AAE5BF9"}}}}
